reference.title: euca-describe-addresses
reference.shortdesc: Shows a list of public IP address that you have allocated. If you have assigned these to an instance, this list also includes the associated instance for each IP.

row.entry: One or more elastic IP addresses.

section.title: Available Filters
section.p: You can add filters to your request so that the response includes information for only certain elastic IP addresses. For example, you can use a filter to return only the addresses that have a specific tag. Some tips for using filters with this command:

ul.li: You can use multiple values for a filter. Eucalyptus responds with information for an address only if it matches at least one of the filter values that you specified.

You can use multiple filters. For example, you can specify addresses that have a specific tag. Eucalyptus responds with the information for an address only if it matches all the filters that you specified. If there is no match, Eucalyptus returns an empty response.

You can use wildcards in a filter value. Use an asterisk (*) to match zero or more characters. Use a question mark (?) to match exactly one character. To escape special characters, use a backslash (\) before the character. For example, a value of \*eucalyptus\?\\ searches for the literal string *eucalyptus?\.

section.p: The following are the available filters for euca-describe-addressess:

row.entry: This filter is hardcoded to standard. There are no other valid values.
ID of the instance associated with the IP address

ul.li: Instance ID that the IP address is assigned to

section.title: Examples
section.codeblock: euca-describe-addresses ADDRESS 86.75.30.9 None standard ADDRESS 86.75.30.10 i-E7AC420A standard

euca-describe-addresses ADDRESS 86.75.30.9 available (arn:aws:euare::790547641019:user/admin) standard ADDRESS 86.75.30.10 i-E7AC420A (arn:aws:euare::790547641019:user/admin) standard ADDRESS 86.75.30.11 nobody standard
